subject: Climate & Environment
title: Pollution and the Brain
description: A quick, practical guide to Pollution and the Brain.

hook.text: Scientists found soot particles inside the brain cells of people living in polluted cities.

buildup.text: Ultrafine particles are so small they pass from lungs to blood to brain.

discovery.text: Long-term exposure is linked to faster cognitive decline and higher dementia risk.

twist.text: Children in polluted areas score lower on memory and attention tests than rural peers.

climax.text: Air pollution may be contributing to the global rise in neurodegenerative diseases.

punchline.text: The air we breathe may be quietly dimming the mind.

quiz.question: What have scientists found inside brain cells of people in polluted cities?
